Deficiency Narrative: The operation's serious incident report policy states that employees shall report serious incidents to the abuse hotline, without delegating the reporting to another party. Based on the information provided, staff are required to only document serious incidents so management staff can review the incidents and report to the hotline when deemed necessary. Therefore, operation staff failed to follow their written serious incident reporting policy.
Correction Narrative: The operation was notified of HHSC's intent to deny a permit on 8/5/2024. The operation has no children in care and is no longer allowed to operate. A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation on 8/14/2024. The operation appears to be closed, and there does not appear to be any staff or children present at the operation. The permit holder was contacted via phone call during the inspection. The permit holder confirmed that all children have been discharged, and there are no staff working at the operation. The permit holder was not able to meet licensing at the operation at the time of the inspection. The permit holder contacted two former operation staff to see if they could meet licensing at the operation. Neither staff was available. The permit holder was provided with instructions on how to mail the operation's permit to licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the five serious incident reports reviewed, four of the incidents were related to children in care sustaining injuries that required medical attention. Three of those incident reports did not have any documentation for any type of medical intervention by operation staff or medical professionals. Additionally, the fifth serious incident report related to a child being in possession of a vape pen had no type of invention or resolution documented for the incident.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through, there were unlocked chemicals under the kitchen sink, in the downstairs bathroom, and in the laundry room.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email stating that the children had left the temporary location and went back to the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through, there was a roll of sausage in the refrigerator that was not properly packaged and stored. This was corrected at inspection.
The operation failed to submit a correction plan or proof of corrections addressing the service planning team involvement in the development of a child's service plan by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email with the following corretions: Service Plan re-training with Case Manager Xaley Woolfolk. To ensure that all persons on the treatment team are notified within 14 days. We will ensure the 14-day notice is completed and sent to appropriate parties and we will maintain a record of it. We also will send completed copy of the service plan and request signatures within 10 days after completion if the parties did not participate in the original service planning day..

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit a correction plan or proof of corrections addressing the caregiver's TB test results by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative:
Krystle Johnson is scheduled for a new TB Test 7/30/24 to replace her initial results.
Update: Krystle was able to obtain a copy of her original T.B. test. Please see attached

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit a correction plan or proof of corrections addressing the direct care staff yelling at a child in care by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative:
Retraining all staff to address appropriate and effective discipline. Review the Discipline Policy and Facility Staff will sign. Scheduled for 7/31/2024.
Update: Sheree Holmes conducted the discipline training on 7/31/24. Gayun Matthews, Xaley Woolfolk, Krystle Johnson, Marie Higgs, Patricia Morris (new hire), and Thelesha Peterson (possible new hire) were present. A second training will be held on Tuesday, August 6,2024 for the remaining staff to attend. Please see the attached sign-in sheet and acknowledgement sheets. Training certificates will be stored in each person s file by 8/2/2024 for 7/31/2024 attendees and within 48 hours after the training for those attending on 8/2/2024.

Retraining on Serious Incidents and Reporting. When and Who to report to with Time frames. Scheduled for 7/31/2024
Update: Sheree Holmes conducted the serious incidents and reporting training on 7/31/24. Gayun Matthews, Xaley Woolfolk, Krystle Johnson, Marie Higgs, Patricia Morris (new hire), and Thelesha Peterson (possible new hire) were present. Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit a correction plan or proof of corrections addressing the physical site by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email witth the following corrections: Due to having to relocate the facility July 16th - July 26th; this task was paused. The repair company was at the facility on July 16th to assess the work to be done, they did bring materials on this date and had to leave when we were notified to relocate. Currently the repair crew will reconvene on 7/31/24. The repair crew arrived while the inspector was at the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: During interviews it was determined the three victims discovered a wine bottle in the refrigerator, however the four staff interviewed denied being aware of the wine bottle at the location.  It was noted the bottle of wine was in the refrigerator within reach of children for three days.
Correction Narrative: The operation was notified of HHSC's intent to deny a permit on 8/5/2024. The operation has no children in care and is no longer allowed to operate. A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation on 8/14/2024. The operation appears to be closed, and there does not appear to be any staff or children present at the operation. The permit holder was contacted via phone call during the inspection. The permit holder confirmed that all children have been discharged, and there are no staff working at the operation. The permit holder was not able to meet licensing at the operation at the time of the inspection. The permit holder contacted two former operation staff to see if they could meet licensing at the operation. Neither staff was available. The permit holder was provided with instructions on how to mail the operation's permit to licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: An opened bottle of wine was observed in a refrigerator accessible to children in care during a walkthrough of the operation's temporary location.
Correction Narrative:
An opened bottle of wine was observed in a refrigerator accessible to children in care during a walkthrough of the operation's temporary location. 

An inspection was completed at the temporary location and there was no bottle of alcohol or any other prohibited items at the facilityl. This standard was found compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide corrections for this citation given on 7/9/2024. This is a result of medication not being stored in a locked container during the time the children were being transported to a relocation center.
Correction Narrative: TVOH will ensure to store medication in a locked container during possible transport to a temporary location. TVOH will utilize lock boxes that are currently at the facility.  TVOH reviewed this standard with Case Manager and DCS lead.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide corrections for physical site issues that were found during an inspection.
Correction Narrative: The landlord, has been notified of the items in need of repair.  The work is scheduled to begin on 7/16/2024.  The facility will be assessed monthly and noted repairs will be listed on the monthly facility check list moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide corrections for this citation that was issued on 7/9/2024. This citation was given due to the mold being present at the operation.
Correction Narrative: TVOH has been working with our landlord to address the non-harmful mold, penicillium.  Servpro in Texarkana, TX will conduct the non-harmful mold.  We are waiting for the service date.  Servpro noted they were behind due to the recent weather issues in the area.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to provide corrections for this citation given on 7/9/2024. The operation's administrator has not been present and provided on-site duties.
Correction Narrative: TVOH has a 30-day plan to have our current case manager become the primary administrator and our current administrator to serve as a back-up.  During the 30-day plan our current administrator will work to meet the 30-hour requirement for this standard. We will have a sign-in sheet for the administrator to log her hours and a weekly report will be submitted.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit proof of a thermometer reading 40 degrees Fahrenheit or below in the mini fridge in the kitchen by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: The operation purchased a thermometer for the minifridge.  Administration will monitor the presence and use of the thermometers on a monthly checklist.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit a correction plan or proof of corrections addressing the uncovered food stored in the refrigerator and pantry by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: The operation purchased disposable containers that will be used to store food no longer in its original packaging.  A meeting was held with all residents and staff discussing the importance of using appropriate storage containers to prevent possible contamination.  Staff will conduct daily checks to ensure uncovered food is not stored in the refrigerators.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit evidence of thermometers being installed in all freezers and exhibiting temperatures below 0 degrees Fahrenheit by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: The operation purchased thermometers for all refrigerators and freezers.  Administration has accepted responsibility for ensuring the use of these thermometers and will monitor on a monthly checklist.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit proof of the repair or removal of the deep freeze unit by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: The operation has removed all food from the damaged deep freezer and removed it from service.  It has been disconnected and marked with a sign stating "Please Do Not Use" until it can be properly removed from the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to submit corrections exhibiting completion of the repairs to the drywall in the bedroom and rec room or the securing of the bare nail in the resident wall by the compliance date.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted proof of correspondence with the repair team scheduling repairs to begin on Tuesday (7/16/24).  The operation submitted repair requests to the landlord and has no control over the completion of those work requests.  This scheduled maintenance brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two direct care staff failed to provide adequate supervision due to them sleeping while on shift supervising children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation was notified of HHSC's intent to deny a permit on 8/5/2024. The operation has no children in care and is no longer allowed to operate. A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation on 8/14/2024. The operation appears to be closed, and there does not appear to be any staff or children present at the operation. The permit holder was contacted via phone call during the inspection. The permit holder confirmed that all children have been discharged, and there are no staff working at the operation. The permit holder was not able to meet licensing at the operation at the time of the inspection. The permit holder contacted two former operation staff to see if they could meet licensing at the operation. Neither staff was available. The permit holder was provided with instructions on how to mail the operation's permit to licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: During the second follow-up inspection, I observed the freezer unit in the pantry area does not close properly, resulting in frost ringing the unit and the freezer not sealing properly.  The freezer has food items stored within.

During the second follow-up inspection, I observed the damage to the drywall in the recreation room remains unrepaired, a cracking drywall patch in a bedroom remains unrepaired, and an unsecured nail in a bedroom remained.  The previous resident of the room had recent self-injurious behaviors, and the room is currently occupied by a new resident without the nail being removed.  These errors were not corrected from the preceding follow-up inspection.
During the inspection, I observed the deep freezer in the pantry area that does not close and containes food items lacks a thermometer and internal temperature cannot be verified.

During the inspection, I observed an uncovered drink cup containing fluid in the mini-fridge and a container of animal crackers with no lid, leaving both items intended for consumption unprotected from contamination.
During the second follow-up inspection, I observed a mini-fridge in the kitchen still lacked a thermometer.

During the initial inspection, three of four personnel records reviewed did not have the correct CPR training to serve pediatrics/adult as required by Minimum Standards. During the follow up inspection completed on 7/8/2024, the three personnel records still did not have pediatrics/adult CPR certificates.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's executive director advised via safety plan, all staff CPR courses were reviewed. One staff has the required CPR. Three staff only have Adult CPR. Two staff have a card that says Basic Life Support (CPR and AED) in person program. Staff were asked to reach out to the instructor for clarification regarding the adult, child and infant training. Our plan of action is to have all staff complete the appropriate training as soon as possible.  We left a message to the provider to schedule a training.  We have two targeted dates, July 14 and July 21.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, it was discovered the operation did not notify RCCR when the operation was rendered unsafe or unsanitary requiring the children and staff to relocate to another location. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 7/19/2024, the operation's executive director advised TVOH will ensure to report required incidents to licensing as soon as we are made aware of allegations or indications of abuse, neglect, or exploitation of a child. TVOH hosted a virtual meeting to re-train all staff on serious incidents and reporting abuse and neglect.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, it was discovered that 3 of the 6 children currently enrolled, were missing a 90 day follow up suicide screening as required in Minimum Standards. During the follow up inspection completed on 7/8/2024, the three child's records still did not have a 90 day follow up suicide screening.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's executive director advised via safety plan, TVOH will follow the Suicide Policy when conducting the initial suicide screening upon admission. TVOH is currently using Calibri Health for all behavioral therapeutic services. The initial suicide will be conducted by Calibri at the time of admission, after an incident, and the 90 day. If Calibri Health is not available to complete the above-mentioned, we will have the Treatment Director to assist. The Treatment Director is currently trained to complete the CSSR. TVOH will have upper management, Case Worker and DCS certified to complete the mentioned above by September 11, 2024. All staff will complete the required DFPS Suicide Training by July 13, 2024. This training is aligned with the requirements mentioned in our policy.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, it was discovered the permit holder has failed to maintain compliance with Minimum Standards at all times. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's executive director advised via safety plan, the permit holder and administrator discussed the obligation to respond to all requested deficiencies in the given time frame. Both ensured that all deficiencies will be addressed prior to or within the given correction date.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, a child's service plan was reviewed for corrections from a previous deficiency, and at that time it was observed that the service plan was completed but it was developed without the service planning team's involvement. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.

During the initial inspection, it was discovered the operation did not notify parents when the operation was rendered unsafe or unsanitary requiring the children and staff to relocate to another location. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.

During the initial inspection, four of four personnel records reviewed, were lacking 1 hour of annual suicide prevention training. During the follow up inspection completed on 7/8/2024, the four personnel records still did not have the annual suicide prevention training.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's Executive Director advised via safety plan, all staff will complete the required DFPS Suicide Training by July 13, 2024. This training is aligned with the requirements mentioned in our policy.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, one of the four personnel records reviewed, did not have a TB exam. During the follow up inspection completed on 7/8/2024, the personnel record still did not have a TB exam.

During the initial inspection, a caregiver was heard yelling at a child about taking clothes that didn't belong to the child. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.

During the initial inspection, it was observed the child care administrator has been frequently absent and did not have a licensed child care administrator designated to be responsible for the operation in their absence. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's executive director advised via safety plan, TVOH is aware that we are currently in need of providing an alternate Administrator to ensure we always meet the minimum standard. Our current Administrator will work a minimum of 3 days a week to meet the required hours.  The 3 days will be floating dates depending on the schedule and need. The administrator will complete a sign in sheet that will have the following: date worked, start time and end time.  The Administrators schedule is floating dates and times to meet the required 30 hrs. total.  The Administrator will have a weekly overview of work done, i.e. files reviewed, correction action plans, and trainings administered.

Deficiency Narrative: During the initial inspection, it was discovered the child care administrator was not present. Six children were interviewed and all denied knowing who she was or having seen her. Corrections were due on 7/3/2024 and at the time of the follow-up inspection on 7/8/2024, the corrections were not made. The operation was re-cited for this deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 7/15/2024, the operation's executive director advised via safety plan, the current Administrator will work a minimum of 3 days a week to meet the required hours.  The 3 days will be floating dates depending on the schedule and need.  (note: The Administrator will have a separate schedule from the Executive Director). The current Administrator has been cleared to drive.  She has been and will stay in Tyler on the days she will work in Linden.  The administrator will complete a sign in sheet that will have the following: date worked, start time and end time.  The Administrators schedule is floating dates and times to meet the required 30 hrs. total.  The Administrator will have a weekly overview of work done, i.e. files reviewed, correction action plans, and trainings administered.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection on 5/30/2024, the operation was issued a deficiency as it was observed several bedrooms/bathrooms were not in good repair. Corrections were due on 6/10/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024 and 7/8/2024, there were three bedrooms with chipped paint. The operation was re-cited for the deficiency.

During a follow up inspection, it was found that there were still several issues with the exterior of the building. There was paint peeling off the building and siding was missing with insulation exposed. In the interior of the building the floors in the hallway and staff areas needed repair. There was paint peeling in 4 of the occupied rooms and 2 of the unoccupied rooms. Several of the screens had holes in them and needed repair. In two of the occupied rooms the drywall had cracks.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was learned that a non-staff member verbal threatened to physically discipline a child in care.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email stating the following: This is a training issue. Upper Management was not made aware of this altercation until after the fact. Child Rights Will Be Reviewed on 7/31/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was learned that a non-staff member was at the operation on several occasions and did not have a complete background check. This non-staff member had access to children in care.
Correction Narrative:
CEO sent email stating the following: All Staff is aware that anyone frequenting the facility or around the foster children must have a completed background check.  In this case the person in question is the spouse of a former employee.  The gentle man is a State Patrolman and drove his truck to deliver large items to the facility. We did ask him for a background check in which we did run.  He was advised he could not come to the We were unaware that he was coming to the property on a frequent basis.  

Update:  All staff will receive training regarding background checks requirements to review the background check requirements and eligibility for staff, volunteers and frequent visitors. Training was held on 7/31/2024 for most staff.  The remaining staff will complete the training on 8/6/2024.  All training certificates will be placed in the employee file within 48 hours of training.  The initial background check submission for the non-staff member in questions is attached. The non-staff member was notified additional steps needed to be taken to be deemed eligible

Corrections were due on 6/6/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024, corrections had not been received and the operation was re-cited for the deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 6/27/2024, the operation's Director provided a corrective action plan which included all management staff will complete additional Intake and Discharge training. The administrator or Program Director will sign off on discharge summaries. Effective 6/27/2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection on 5/30/2024, the operation was issued a deficiency as it was observed several bedrooms/bathrooms were not in good repair. Corrections were due on 6/10/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024, there were three bedrooms with chipped paint. The operation was re-cited for the deficiency.

During the first initial inspection on 5/30/2024, the operation was issued a deficiency as it was observed staff did not report a child's suicide attempt, timely. Corrections were due on 5/30/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024, corrections had not been received and the operation was re-cited for the deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 6/27/2024, the operation's Director provided a corrective action plan which included all management and direct care staff will complete additional Serious Incident and Reporting training. All training will be completed by July 15, 2024. All training certificates will be placed in the staff personnel file upon completion.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection on 5/30/2024, the operation was issued a deficiency as it was observed staff did not complete a child's discharge documentation correctly. Corrections were due on 6/6/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024, corrections had not been received and the operation was re-cited for the deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 6/27/2024, the operation's Director provided a corrective action plan which included all management staff will complete additional Intake and Discharge training. The administrator or Program Director will sign off on discharge summaries. Effective 6/27/2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection on 5/30/2024, the operation was issued a deficiency as it was observed staff did not maintain current, true, accurate and complete records. Corrections were due on 6/6/2024. During the follow up inspection on 6/26/2024, corrections had not been received and the operation was re-cited for the deficiency.
Correction Narrative: On 6/27/2024, the operation's Director provided a corrective action plan which included all management and direct care staff will complete additional medication management training. The Village of Open Hearts will institute a double check process to manage the accuracy of medication records. The medication records will be checked twice daily by a supervisor/case manager, once in the morning and once in the evening. Effective 6/27/2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, a child's service plan was reviewed for corrections from a previous deficiency, and at that time it was observed that the service plan was completed but it was developed without the service planning team's involvement.

During the inspection, I observed a freezer unit in the pantry area that did not seal well, creating a rim of ice that prevents the freezer from being closed fully.  Food items were stored in this freezer.
During the follow-up inspection, I observed one of six children's records still failed to record the prescribing physician for two prescription medications.  This standard will be recited.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, I observed the med sheet lacking the prescribing doctor was no longer in the records due to the child being discharged.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, I observed damage to the drywall in a recreation room, a cracking drywall patch in a bedroom, and an unsecured nail in the wall of a resident with recent self-injurious behaviors.  These errors were not corrected from the preceding inspection.
During the inspection, I observed a mini-fridge in the kitchen still lacked a thermometer.
The operation had to temporarily relocate the children in care due to a physical site concern and did not report the incident to licensing.
Correction Narrative: The operation was notified of HHSC's intent to deny a permit on 8/5/2024, and as of this date, the operation has not requested an administrative review. The operation has no children in care and is no longer allowed to operate. A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation on 8/14/2024. The operation appears to be closed, and there does not appear to be any staff or children present at the operation. The permit holder was contacted via phone call during the inspection. The permit holder confirmed that all children have been discharged, and there are no staff working at the operation. The permit holder was not able to meet licensing at the operation at the time of the inspection. The permit holder contacted two former operation staff to see if they could meet licensing at the operation. Neither staff was available. The permit holder was provided with instructions on how to mail the operation's permit to licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple training certificates include the signature of the administrator, but the administrator denied being present for the training, facilitating the training, or signing the certificates.
Correction Narrative: The operation was notified of HHSC's intent to deny a permit on 8/5/2024, and as of this date, the operation has not requested an administrative review. The operation has no children in care and is no longer allowed to operate. A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation on 8/14/2024. The operation appears to be closed, and there does not appear to be any staff or children present at the operation. The permit holder was contacted via phone call during the inspection. The permit holder confirmed that all children have been discharged, and there are no staff working at the operation. The permit holder was not able to meet licensing at the operation at the time of the inspection. The permit holder contacted two former operation staff to see if they could meet licensing at the operation. Neither staff was available. The permit holder was provided with instructions on how to mail the operation's permit to licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was required to relocate the children due to safety concerns and during the transport of the medication it was not secured in a locked container. The unlocked medication was transported with the children.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email that they would ensure all medication is stored under a locked container and retrain staff. Follow up inspection was conducted on 7/31/2024, Medication storage was checked and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection it was found that there were several issues with the exterior of the building. There was paint peeling off the building and siding was missing with insulation exposed. In the interior of the building the floors in the hallway and staff areas needed repair. There was paint peeling in 4 of the occupied rooms and 2 of the unoccupied rooms. In 2 of the occupied and unoccupied rooms screens needed to be installed properly. Several of the screens had holes in them and needed repair. In two of the occupied rooms the drywall had cracks. In one of bathrooms the bathtub was slow to drain.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email that the landlord had been notified of the physical site issues and repairs are scheduled to begin on 7/16/2024. A follow up inspection was conducted today, and repairs were being done while the inspectors were at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During a review of the medication records 2 children's records showed missed doses of medication with no explanation given. One child's medication was missed, and the explanation was the child was on an outing.
Correction Narrative:
CEO sent email that all management and direct care staff will complete additional medication management training.
-The Village of Open Hearts will institute a double check process to manage the accuracy of medication records.  The medication records will be checked twice daily by a supervisor/case manager, once in the morning and once in the evening. A follow up inspection was conducted on 7/31/2024 where medication was checked and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was learned that the administrator has not been to the operation for on-site administrative oversite. It appears that none of the children and many of the staff are no familiar with the administrator and have not either met her or seen her in months.
Correction Narrative: CEO sent email that case manager is in the process of becoming the administrator. During the transition time the current administrator would be working 30 hours a week with sign in sheets at the facilty.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was learned that the operation had mold in part of the building. The operation was supposed to have this mold tested but never sent licensing the results.
Correction Narrative: Ceo sent email that a mold team would be at the facility on 7/18/2024 to clean up the mold.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing medication records, I observed a child was administered a medication several days after the label indicated the medication should be discontinued.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, I observed the noted medication was  removed from the operation, preventing possible recurrance.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing the medications, I observed two discontinued medications stored in the active medication bins.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, I observed the expired medications were removed from the operation.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed damage to the drywall in a recreation room, a cracking drywall patch in a bedroom, and unsecured nails in the wall of a resident with recent self-injurious behaviors.
In reviewing the medicaitons, I observed the prescription nasal spray for one child was stored without the prescription label denoting the administration instructions and identity of receiving child.
During the inspection, I observed a mini-fridge in the kitchen area that lacked a thermometer.
In reviewing the medication records, I observed two of three children's records reviewed failed to document the name of physician prescribing the medication.
During the inspection, I observed two plates of food stored in refrigerators with no covering or protection from contamination.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed all food to be properly stored and protected from contamination.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered a resident's suicide screening record was incomplete, lacking prompted responses in three places; a serious incident report lacks documentation of the date and time the parent was notified despite interviews confirming this notification occurred; and a list of individuals approved to administer the suicide screening tool was provided including the name of a case manager unqualified to administer the tool.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated all staff were reminded all documentation is to be completed thoroughly.  This was also translated to the third-party Behavioral Health Services provider.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the operation failed to properly supervise a resident according to his safety plan following a recent suicide attempt.
Correction Narrative: On 8/1/24 and 8/5/24, I contacted the operation regarding the need for a correction plan entry for this standard.  The operation failed to reply.  The operation was denied their initial permit and ceased operating on 8/5/24.  Due to the closure, the operation will not be providing supervision to any more children in care, and as such, this standard is brought into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the operation failed to debrief with the residents and staff following the suicide attempt to offer mental health referrals as required.
Correction Narrative: Administration reviewed the suicide policy with the case manager to ensure she is aware of to address proper follow-ups.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the operation failed to complete the postvention review of lessons learned following this suicide attempt.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided proof of communication to the behavioral health services provider clarifying the need for the postvention plan.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the first administration of the suicide screening tool on a resident was completed four months after admission to the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation met with their behavioral health services provider to ensure they understood the minimum standards requirements and the screening tool was added to their intake checklist.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered a child exited the building to the parking lot alone after a suicide attempt while caregivers remained in the building.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the operation failed to complete the follow-up medical appointment for a child taken to the hospital for suicidal evaluation in a timely manner.
Correction Narrative: The operation reported this to be an oversight on the part of the case manager.  Expectations were reviewed with the case manager regarding after care instructions.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the operation failed to operate according to its accepted suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policies.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the admission assessment for a resident receiving treatment services was not completed until 20 days after admission.
Correction Narrative: The operation indicated this was an oversight on the case manager's part. The operation submitted proof of training held on 7/31/24 for the case manager responsible for completing the admission assessments.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered the caregivers and supervising staff were not made aware of the line-of-sight supervision expectation noted in the child's safety plan and do not receive copies of the plans nor notification of their contents.
Correction Narrative: The operation noted this to be a training oversight and indicated direct care staff would be made aware of all children's supervision levels.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I discovered a resident over the age of ten years did not receive his 90-day administration of the suicide screening tool.
Correction Narrative: The operation met with their behavioral health services provider to ensure they understood the minimum standards requirements and the screening tool was added to their intake checklist.  The operation provided proof of a training held on 7/31/24 with a second training to be held on 8/6/24.  All staff will be retrained with training certificates in the file by 8/2/24 for those trained on 7/31/24 and within 48 hours for those trained on 8/6/24.  This mitigates the risk of recurrence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection, there were five bedrooms observed with chipped paint in the bathroom or bedrooms, there were two bedrooms with dirty toilets, one bedroom had exposed wires, the recreation room had exposed wires, and one bedroom without lights due what appeared to be to electrical issues.

During the first initial inspection, there were two medication records that did not follow the prescribing health care professional's orders. One child was missing multiple days of medication while another child was missing one single dose of medication.
During the first initial inspection, one of four records reviewed did not contain the discharge documentation for a child.
During the first initial inspection, there was one child's record that did not include an admissions assessment.
During the first initial inspection, there were four child records reviewed and all four were missing suicide screenings at admission.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection, it was discovered that a serious incident report was documented for a child's suicide attempt, however, licensing was not contacted timely and notified of the incident.
During the first initial inspection, there were four child files reviewed and it was observed that three did not contain immunizations records.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection, while reviewing a child's medication, it was discovered that the operation combined two separate strengths of the same medication, on a single document which created an inaccuracy in the medication log.
During the first initial inspection, there was a standalone freezer that was observed to have been accidentally unplugged causing the ice to melt and the food to spoil.
During the first initial inspection, there were two medication records that were missing the name and signature of person who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection, one child's case file was missing a completed initial service plan within 45 days of admission.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the first initial inspection, two of four records reviewed were missing TB test results for the children.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the DFPS investigation, video footage was requested on seven different occasions by the investigator. Video footage was never made available.
Correction Narrative: Previous video surveillance company referred OH to another company that will be in a better position to service the operation better. They received a quote and will move forward.  They will ensure that all management personnel are trained to download video footage and provide a copy upon request and/or investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the DFPS investigation, it was discovered staff was aware of allegations of abuse, neglect, or exploitation and did not notify RCCR.
Correction Narrative: TVOH hosted a virtual meeting to re-train all staff on serious incidents and reporting abuse and neglect.  See document library for correction response.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed four rooms with baseboards that were separating from the wall or that needed caulking, two rooms with cracked paint in need of repair, damaged tile on the floor of the laundry room and in the hallway, exposed wires in the recreation room capped with wiring nuts but accessible to children, and an exposed drain in the hallway that needs capping.
Correction Narrative:
On 3/25/2024, the Director emailed photographs of physical site corrections including wall repairs, flooring in the laundry room, flooring in the staff area, and hallway flooring. The Director noted temporary flooring was installed while they wait on permanent flooring to be delivered and base is currently being replaced, today. 

On 3/26/2024, the Director provided photographs of physical site corrections including covering wires in the recreation room, fixed baseboards, painted walls, and covered drain pipe.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, two of two child's records were reviewed and both were missing orientation information completed with the children within 7 days of placement.
Correction Narrative: On 3/8/2024, the Director provided a copy of the completed orientation forms for both child records.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, the freezer thermometer indicated the freezer was at 12 degrees fahrenheit, and not at the required 0 degrees or below.
Correction Narrative: On 3/26/2024, the Director provided a photograph to verify correction of freezer thermometer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection of medications, I reviewed 2 children's medication records consisting of 6 medication logs. All records reviewed had the initials of the person who administered the medication but did not match the person who signed the medication log.
Correction Narrative: On 3/1/2024, the program director provided an email attachment with printed and signed names of all persons who have administered medications to the children in care. The operation has created an updated medication log to require printed names and signatures of all caregivers who administer medication.

Deficiency Narrative: The Child Care Administrator was not present for the monitoring inspection and has not been present for any monitoring inspections since issuance of the initial permit.
Correction Narrative: On 3/26/2024, the Director provided corrections for the administrative duties to include written duties and a working schedule.

Deficiency Narrative: During the sampling inspection, one of two child's record reviewed, was missing a non-emergency admission assessment prior to admission.
Correction Narrative: On 3/8/2024, the Director provided a copy of the child's missing admission assessment.

Deficiency Narrative: The four fire extinguishers at the operation were due for inspection in November of 2023.
Correction Narrative: On 1/18/2024, the Director provided photographs to reflect the operation had the fire extinguishers serviced.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the operation, it was observed in several designated bedroom's bathrooms have dirty water running out of the faucets. In one of the designated bedroom's bathroom, it was observed a shelf was sitting in the sink instead of being mounted on the wall.
Correction Narrative: On 1/29/2024, the Director advised she has contacted the city who reported they are installing new pipes throughout the city. She advised she has requested a letter of confirmation. On 2/13/2024, the Director advised a letter has not been provided by the city and the operation will not place children in the effected rooms until the water issue has been resolved.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through it was noted the window in room twenty did not have a screen. It was also noted room eighteen had insects in the room.
Correction Narrative: On 1/26/2024, the Director provided a photograph to verify the screen has been replaced on the window.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, one of three personnel files reviewed did not contain the documentation to reflect the operation contacted the required references to verify that the applicant is suitable to work with or around children.
Correction Narrative: On 9/28/2023, the executive director provided corrections via email; two candidate reference checks were provided for the treatment director.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, it was noted the operation is providing treatment services, but does not have a treatment director that has completed the hiring process.
Correction Narrative: On 10/4/2023, the Executive Director provided documentation to reflect the treatment director had completed her background checks and was eligible with provisions. On 10/5/2023, the Executive Director provided training certificates to reflect the treatment director has completed the hiring process and is actively employed.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, employee records maintained at the operation were not complete. The employee records were missing training certificates for CPR/First Aid, EBI, orientation, pre-service training, and drug test results.
Correction Narrative: On 9/28/2023, the executive director provided corrections via email stating The Village of Open Hearts will ensure that all personnel records are maintained at the operation. At the time of the visit, personnel documents were being sent to the corporate office for processing. The Village of Open Hearts has ensured that all current active files are processed, recorded, and maintained at the operation and that future documents are sent directly to the operation for processing and stored in personnel files.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, two of three personnel files did not contain the required TB test results.
Correction Narrative: On 10/5/2023, the executive director provided TB test results for the administrator and treatment director.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, employee records maintained at the operation were not complete. The employee records were missing training certificates for CPR/First Aid, EBI, orientation, pre-service training, and drug test results.
During the inspection, I observed that the mock file did not include a mock EBI report for review.
The care for children and adults policy beginning on page 215, states "adults in care act as caregivers and The Village of Open Hearts will maintain its caregiver ratios."
Correction Narrative: On 9/19/2023, the executive director provided an updated copy of the policy which reflected the required changes.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the mock preliminary service plan did not include a field to be approved by the Treatment Director or PLSP.  The form indicates it is to be signed by a CPMS.
Correction Narrative: The operation's executive director provided a template that will be used in the children's case file to document the preliminary service plan which included a field for approval from the case manager and treatment director/PLSP

Deficiency Narrative: Per the operation's transportation and travel policy on page 174, the operation allows transportation of children by caregivers over the age of 18. The transportation policy beginning on page 248, reflects the caregiver must be over the age of 21.
Correction Narrative: On 9/19/2023, the executive director provided an updated copy of the policy which reflected the required changes.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the mock file lacked documentation for resident discharge.
Correction Narrative: The operation's executive director provided a template that will be used in the children's case file to document discharge/transfers.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the mock file does not include a field on the exterior of the file or easily identifiable upon the interior of the file folder wherein staff would note any known allergies or medical conditions for emergency reference.
Correction Narrative: The operation's executive director provided a template that will be used in the children's case file to provide the DOB, date of admit, allergies, and chronic health conditions.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was observed that bedrooms 7, 18, and 19 did not have working hot water in the shower.
Correction Narrative: The operation's executive director provided a copy of the invoice to verify the operation contacted a local plumber and they fixed the hot water in the bathrooms.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, two of three personnel files did not contain the required TB test results.
During the follow up inspection, it was noted the operation is providing treatment services, but does not have a treatment director that has completed the hiring process.
During the follow up inspection, two of three personnel files did not contain the current job description document required by minimum standards.
Correction Narrative: The operation's executive director provided a copy of the job description for the missing employee files (facility manager and treatment director.

Deficiency Narrative: During the follow up inspection, two of three personnel files reviewed did not contain the documentation to reflect the operation contacted the required references to verify that the applicant is suitable to work with or around children.
During the inspection, the operation was unable to provide access to all active records for immediate review.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, the operation was able to produce a mock resident file and requested employee files.

Deficiency Narrative: The discipline and punishment policy, beginning on page 221, does not include a statement that discipline of any type is not allowable for infants.
Correction Narrative: The operation's policy contained a statement that discipline of any type is not allowable for infants.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through it was noted the operation failed to post the emergency evacuation & relocation diagram.
Correction Narrative: The operation has posted emergency evacuation and relocation diagrams in the main hallway.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's plans, policies, and procedures does not indicate the date adopted and effective date.
Correction Narrative: The operation plans and policies included dates adopted and effective.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's suicide prevention, intervention, postvention policy on page 105, indicates that if a parent insists, they can be present for the screening.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy was reviewed and reflected how the operation may perform screenings that meet the child's privacy.

Deficiency Narrative: The purpose and mission statement, located on page 2, states "Open Hearts Children and Family Services (also referred to as Open Hearts or OHCFS in this document) is a license Foster Care Child Placement and Adoption Agency."
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated copy of the policy removing the erroneous notation of the operation as a CPA and correctly identifying it as a GRO.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the operation did not provide a complete child's record for review.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a mock case file for review.

Deficiency Narrative: The care for children and adults policy beginning on page 215, states "adults in care act as caregivers and The Village of Open Hearts will maintain its caregiver ratios."

The admission policy, beginning on page 39, does not specify the child's rights to receive and give gifts to family, friends, employees, or other children in care, including any restrictions on gifts.
Correction Narrative: The operation's policy contained child's rights to recei e and give gifts.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's refrigerator and freezer did not contain a thermometer to measure the temperature.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, it was observed that the operation had working thermometers in the refrigerator and freezer.

Deficiency Narrative: During the standard-by-standard inspection, the operation failed to have their fire inspection completed.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, the operation provided proof of a completed and cleared fire inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: During the standard-by-standard inspection, it was noted the operation is providing treatment services, but does not have a treatment director.
The operation's suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy found on page 177, does not indicate the operation will promote suicide prevention training for non-employees.
Correction Narrative: The operation's suicide policy contained promotion for non-employees to complete suicide prevention training.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy found on page 177, indicates the operation will utilize the training curriculum by the Suicide Coalition of Texas, ASK Gatekeeper.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy was reviewed and reflected at least one hour of annual suicide prevention training is required for each employee.

Deficiency Narrative: During the standard-by-standard inspection, the operation reported having the health inspection completed, but failed to provide the documentation.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, the operation provided proof of a completed and clear health inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: The admission policy, located on page 36, states "The Village of Open Hearts to provide Emergency Care Services to you in need of substitute foster care or other out of home care." It is also observed that the policy uses emergency care services and emergency admissions, interchangeably.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the operation's policy was reviewed and included a description of each program offered.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk-through it was noted that the operation's medication room had a keypad/key lock on the door, however, inside the room they did not have a lock box or a lock on a cabinet to ensure Schedule II medications were double locked. The staff reported they would purchase a lock to go on the cabinet.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the medication storage to be appropriately locked and secured.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was noted that several bedrooms had blinds that broken, a bedroom had a tear in the wallpaper, bedroom light wasn't working, exposed wires in offices and living room, 5 gallon bucket of paint in the bathroom, and the room with the Saints decor was missing trim.
The operation's incident report does not include the operation's telephone number.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the Serious Incident Report has been updated to show pending  as the phone number instead of the incorrect number previously noted as the operation awaits a permanent operation line.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not provide a policy (748.123), to include how they plan on protecting the children in care from vaccine-preventable diseases of employees.
Correction Narrative: The operation's policy contained a policy to develop and implement vaccine preventable diseases.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, it was noted that room #311 was missing a shower head. It was also noted that room #8 the bathtub was stopped up and there was sitting brown water that was unable to drain. I observed room #9 to have a toilet that did not work. The laundry room had a non-working toilet as well, and the toilet bowel was full of brown stains, and there was missing sheet rock with exposed pipes.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the bathrooms were clean, maintained and in good repair.

Deficiency Narrative: Per the operation's transportation policy, the operation allows transportation of children by caregivers over the age of 18.
During the walkthrough it was noted the first-aid kit was missing the following, adhesive tape, scissors, and tweezers.
Correction Narrative: Each first aid kit, contained all required supplies.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy does not indicate that the person conducting the suicide screening must meet the conditions and training requirements.
Correction Narrative: During the follow up inspection, the suicide prevention, intervention, and postvention policy was reviewed and reflected how the person conducting a suicide screening must meet the conditions and training requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was observed that four of the six employees still had pending background checks. CBCU advised fingerprints had not been completed and the background checks were set to be closed as non-compliant.
Correction Narrative: All employees with direct contact with children have completed back ground check information.
